string-array.name: uv_caution
string-array.item: Most dangerous because sun exposure can cause skin burns within minutes
Stay indoors as much as possible
Use long-sleeved clothes, hats, and sunglasses when you go out

string-array.name: uv_very_high
string-array.item: Extremely dangerous as sun exposure can cause skin burns within minutes
Avoid going out from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. and stay indoors or in the shade
Use long-sleeved clothes, hats, and sunglasses when you go out

string-array.name: uv_high
string-array.item: Exposure to the sun can cause skin burns within 1–2 hours, which is dangerous
Must stay in the shade in the middle of the day
Use long-sleeved clothes, hats, and sunglasses when you go out

string-array.name: uv_normal
string-array.item: Skin burns can occur even within 2–3 hours of exposure to the sun

string-array.name: uv_low
string-array.item: No protection against sun exposure required
However, people with sensitive skin should apply sunscreen
